Q&A.question: What is the molecular formula of CTH-14?
At what temperature were the crystallographic data for CTH-15 collected?
What is the space group of CTH-16?
Does CTH-14 exhibit porosity in gas sorption experiments?
Q&A.answer: No, CTH-14 shows no porosity in the gas sorption experiment.

Q&A.question: What is the CCDC number for the salt (1,2-di(pyridinium-4-yl)hydrazine)(H2btec)?
What type of net topology does CTH-15 have according to the standard method?
What is the calculated BET surface area for CTH-15?
Is CTH-16 stable in water for at least 1 hour?
Q&A.answer: Yes, CTH-16 was stable in water for at least 1 hour.

Q&A.question: What is the ideal space group for the augmented net approach of CTH-14?
What is the TD10 value for the topology analysis of CTH-15 using the points-of-extension method?
What is the main luminescence transition observed for CTH-15?
Q&A.answer: The transition at 400 nm can be attributed to Ce(III).

Q&A.question: What is the main difference in normalized solid state photoluminescence emission between CTH-16 and 4,4'-azopyridine?
Q&A.answer: CTH-16 shows a broader emission than 4,4'-azopyridine.

Q&A.question: What is the result of the cyclic voltammetry experiment for CTH-15?
Q&A.answer: The voltammogram shows a quasi-reversible electron transfer reaction related to the Ce(IV)/Ce(III) redox couple.

Q&A.question: What is the redox potential of Ce(IV)/Ce(III) in CTH-15 compared to aqueous solution?
Q&A.answer: The redox potential in CTH-15 is about 0.2 V versus Ag/AgCl, which is a large decrease compared to the reversible potential in aqueous solution.

Q&A.question: What does the analysis of CTH-16 suggest about the stability of Ce(IV) in MOFs?
Q&A.answer: The analysis suggests a remarkable stabilization of Ce(IV) compared with solution chemistry.
